article: Father came to Jack's bed and sat down beside him. "  _  kind of day did you have?" " It was a  _  day for me," Jack answered. " I had a fight  _  Tom. The teacher  _  a note home about me. And I talked back to mother." " Yes, part of the day was bad," Mr Brown said. "but tell me about the  _  thing today." Jim smiled. " After school I went  _  alone," he said. " I didn't think I would have any pleasure . But I did. I  _  a fish!" "I'm glad you  _  a good time," Mr Brown said. " Think about it  _  you go to sleep. Now I'm going to  turn off  the light. Happy dreams." Every night, Jack answers the  _  question. " What was the best thing that happened to you today?" Every night  _  going to sleep, Jack thinks about the best thing. Of course he has many happy  _  Sometimes he has to think  _  to find the best thing. Sometimes it is a very small thing.  _  he always finds out a good thing to think about. This is a good way Jack's father has taught to end his day.
